oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-11-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 4, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalists Little Texas Daisy and Lost John, and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Little Texas Daisy; Ford Rush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers perform an excerpt from "Nobody's Business" / (0:22) Announcer closing statement / (0:53) David Stone announces the opening statement, the opening theme music plays, and David Stone introduces George D. Hay / (2:15) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys / (2:34) Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys perform "I'm Sitting On Top Of The World" / (4:31) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (5:27) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon / (5:53) Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon perform "Turkey In The Straw" / (7:32) George D. Hay introduces Little Texas Daisy and Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys / (8:00) Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with Little Texas Daisy perform "Roll Along Kentucky Moon" / (11:05) George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush / (11:34) Ford Rush performs "Throw Another Log On The Fire" / (13:45) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys / (14:05) Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys perform "My Old Pal Of Yesterday" [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Little Texas Daisy; Lost John Miller
